buttons.RedoLastActionToolUseMessage: Click to redo your last action.
buttons.UndoLastActionToolUseMessage: Click to undo your last action.
buttons.MeasureTriangleToolTipMessage: Measure the angles and sides of a triangle.
buttons.MeasureTriangleToolUseMessage: Select three line segments that make a triangle. The measurement is found in the object tab.
buttons.MeasurePolygonToolTipMessage: Measure the angles and sides of a polygon.
buttons.MeasurePolygonToolUseMessage: Select three or more line segments that make a polygon with out crossing. The measurement is found in the object tab.
buttons.CreateAngleToolUseMessage: Select two lines, three points or two segments with an endpoint in common to measure an angle. The measurement is found in the object tab.
buttons.CreateAntipodalPointToolUseMessage: Select a location to create a point (if necessary) and its antipode.
buttons.CreatePolarToolTipMessage: Create polar line or polar points
buttons.CreatePolarToolUseMessage: Select a location to create a point (if necessary) and its polar line or select a line segment or line to create both polar points.
buttons.CreateMidpointToolTipMessage: Create the midpoint of a line segment.
buttons.CreateMidpointToolUseMessage: Select a line segment to create its midpoint.
buttons.CreateAngleBisectorToolTipMessage: Create the angle bisector of a measured angle.
buttons.CreateAngleBisectorToolUseMessage: You must first measure an angle with the Measure Angle tool and then select it with this tool to create its bisector.
buttons.CreateNSectAngleToolTipMessage: Divide an angle into N equal pieces.
buttons.CreateNSectAngleToolUseMessage: Use a number key to select a number then select an existing measured angle to divide into that many equal pieces.
buttons.CreateNSectSegmentToolTipMessage: Divide a line segment into N equal pieces.
buttons.CreateNSectSegmentToolUseMessage: Use a number key to select a number then select an existing line segment to divide into that many equal pieces.
buttons.CreateThreePointCircleToolTipMessage: Create a circle from three points.
buttons.CreateThreePointCircleToolUseMessage: Select three points (not all the same or antipodal) to create the circle through them.
buttons.CreateCircleToolUseMessage: Click to insert a circle with a given center point and through a second point.
buttons.CreateCoordinateToolUseMessage: Select a point to measure and display its x,y,z coordinates on the unit sphere. The measurements are found in the object tab.
buttons.CreateEllipseToolUseMessage: Select two distinct non-antipodal points and another point on the ellipse.
buttons.CreateTranslationToolUseMessage: Create a translation object by selecting a segment or line to translate along and then a measurement or measurable object to determine the length.
buttons.CreateRotationToolUseMessage: Create a rotation object by selecting a point to rotate about and then a measurement or measurable object to determine the angle.
buttons.CreatePointReflectionToolUseMessage: Create a point reflection transformation object by selecting a point to reflect through.
buttons.CreateReflectionToolUseMessage: Create a reflection transformation object by selecting a line or line segment to reflect through.
buttons.CreateInversionToolUseMessage: Create a inversion transformation object by selecting a circle to invert over.
buttons.ApplyTransformationToolUseMessage: Apply a transformation by first selecting transformation object and then selecting geometric objects to apply it to.
buttons.CreateMeasuredCircleToolUseMessage: Select a center point and a measurement or measurable object to determine the radius.
buttons.CreateIntersectionToolUseMessage: Select two one-dimensional objects to create their intersection point(s).
buttons.CreateLineSegmentToolUseMessage: Click to insert line segment defined by two points.
buttons.CreateLineToolUseMessage: Click to insert a line defined by two points.
buttons.CreatePointDistanceToolUseMessage: Select two points to measure the distance between them. The measurement is found in the object tab.
buttons.CreatePointOnOneDimToolTipMessage: Select a one-dimensional object to place a point on
buttons.CreatePointOnOneDimToolUseMessage: Select a one-dimensional object to add a point to.
buttons.CreatePointToolUseMessage: Click to insert a free point.
buttons.CreateSegmentLengthToolUseMessage: Select a Line Segment to measure its length. The measurement is found in the object tab.
buttons.CreateSliderToolUseMessage: Click this button to create a value slider.
buttons.CreateTangentToolUseMessage: Create the tangent lines to a selected non-straight one-dimensional object and a selected location.
buttons.CreatePerpendicularToolUseMessage: Create the perpendicular line(s) to a selected one-dimensional object and a selected location.
buttons.DeleteToolUseMessage: Select objects to delete. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.HideObjectToolUseMessage: Select objects to hide. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.MoveObjectToolUseMessage: Click and drag an object to move it. Movable objects are highlighted on hovering. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.PanZoomInToolUseMessage: Click to zoom in at the location of the mouse. Click and drag to pan the current view.
buttons.PanZoomOutToolUseMessage: Click to zoom out at the location of the mouse. Click and drag to pan the current view.
buttons.ZoomFitToolUseMessage: Fits the sphere in the available space.
buttons.RotateSphereToolUseMessage: Click and drag to rotate the sphere.
buttons.SelectToolUseMessage: Click objects. Hold the Alt/Option key to add to your selection. Hold a key and click *without*  moving to select all objects of that type.
buttons.ToggleLabelToolUseMessage: Click on objects to toggle the display of their labels.
buttons.CreateIconToolUseMessage: Click to create an the SVG paths for an icon from current view.
buttons.ResetSphereActionToolUseMessage: Click to clear the canvas of all objects.
buttons.DummyToolUseMessage: Use instructions for the dummy tool.
buttons.TextToolUseMessage: Click on canvas to place text

objects.angleMarkers: Angle Markers | Angle Marker | angle marker |angle markers
objects.pointReflections: Point Reflections | Point Reflection | point reflection | point reflections

style.label: 1 Label | {count} Labels
style.closeOrSelect: Close the style panel or select object(s).
style.selectionDirection1: Click on glowing objects to select them.
style.selectionDirection2: Hold the Alt/Option key to add or subtract from your selection.
style.selectionDirection3: Press a number key to select an object at that depth.
style.selectionDirection4Mac: Press the p key and click in any empty location to add all points. Similar for lines (l), line segments (s), circles (c), ellipses (e), angle markers (A), parametrics (P), polygons (O), or all objects (command+a).
style.selectionDirection4PC: Press the p key and click in any empty location to add all points. Similar for lines (l), line segments (s), circles (c), ellipses (e), angle markers (A), parametrics (P), polygons (O), or all objects (ctrl+a).
style.noSelectionToolTip: No objects are currently selected. Either select objects with the selection tool or click this button to close the style panel.
style.labelsNotShowingToolTip: Not all labels in the current selection are visible. Click this button to make them visible and then they will be styleable.
style.clickToMakeObjectsVisible: Click the button below to make all objects visible and then to style them.
style.objectsNotShowingToolTip: Not all objects in the current selection are visible. Click this button to make them visible and then they will be styleable.
style.backStyleDifferentValuesToolTip: The selected objects have different automatic back styling settings. At least one is using automatic back styling and at least is not. Click the button make the automatic back styling the same for all selected objects.
style.differentValues: The selected objects have different values for at least one of these style options. Click the button and edit a style to make all selected objects have that style value in common.
style.differentValuesToolTip: The selected objects have different values for at least one style option. Click the button and edit a style to make *all* selected objects have *all* the styles in this block have a common value(s).
style.multiLabelTextToolTip: You cannot edit the text of more than one label at a time.
style.disableDynamicBackStyleToolTip: The styling of objects on the back of the sphere is handled automatically unless disabled. The automatic style depends on a Global Back Styling Contrast percent and the front styling. The contrast is a global variable and applies to all objects the have Dynamic Back Styling enabled. If the contrast is 100%, then there is no difference between the styling of objects on the front and the back of the sphere. If the contrast is 0%, then colors on back of sphere are almost transparent and size reduction is maximized for points and thicknesses. Dash pattern is not effected by the contrast. The Back Contrast percent may be set in the Background Style panel.
style.clearChangesToolTip: Revert the selected object(s) back to the style they had when they were *first* selected.
style.restoreDefaultsToolTip: Revert the selected object(s) back to their default(s).
style.showColorInputsToolTip: Click this to enter color code values directly.
style.disableBackStyleContrastSlider: Click To Disable Dynamic Back Style For Selected Object(s)
style.disableBackStyleContrastSliderToolTip: The selected objects have dynamic back style enabled. Click this button disable it for only the selected object(s). Then you can change the back style of the selected object(s) using the style options in this panel.
style.disableDashPatternSliderToolTip: Click this button to set no dash pattern on all selected object(s).
style.enableBackStyleContrastSlider: Click To Enable Dynamic Back Style For Selected Object(s)
style.enableBackStyleContrastSliderToolTip: The selected objects do not have dynamic back style enabled. Click this button enable it and adjust the Back Contrast Slider.
style.cannotSelectLabels: Labels are not selectable. To style a label, select and style the object it labels and use the Label Style panel.

handlers.transformCreatesSecondPoint: Transforming point {preimagePt} using {type} {trans} would create a second point on top of point {existingPt}.
handlers.pointDoesNotMoveUnderTransformation: Applying {type} {trans} to point {pt} will never move it to a different location.
handlers.duplicateTransformedObject: The {object} {name} has already been transformed by {type} {trans} or transforming {object} {name} using {type} {trans} would create a second {object} on top of {name}.
handlers.latitudeCreationAttemptDuplicate: This latitude has already been created.
handlers.latitudeWithZeroRadius: Latitudes must have a non-zero radius.
handlers.longitudeCreationAttemptDuplicate: This longitude has already been created.
handlers.applyTransformationSelectTransformation: You must select a transformation before you can use this tool.
handlers.nEqualOneAngleNSect: You must choose to divide angles into more than 1 equal pieces.
handlers.nSetAngleNSect: You are dividing angles into {number} equal pieces.
handlers.bisectedAngleAlready: Angle {angle} has already been bisected. Choose another angle or divide this one into more than two equal pieces.
handlers.nSectedAngleAlready: Angle {angle} has already been divided into {number} equal pieces. Choose another angle or divide it into something other than {number} equal pieces.
handlers.angleSuccessfullyNSected: Angle {angle} has be successfully divided into {number} equal pieces.
handlers.nEqualOneSegmentNSect: You must choose to divide segments into more than 1 equal pieces.
handlers.nSetSegmentNSect: You are dividing segments into {number} equal pieces.
handlers.bisectedSegmentAlready: Segment {segment} has already been bisected. Choose another segment or divide this one into more than two equal pieces.
handlers.nSectedSegmentAlready: Segment {segment} has already been divided into {number} equal pieces. Choose another segment or divide it into something other than {number} equal pieces.
handlers.segmentSuccessfullyNSected: Segment {segment} has be successfully divided into {number} equal pieces.
handlers.ellipseAntipodalSelected: The foci of an ellipse are not allowed to be antipodal or identical. Select another location.
handlers.ellipseFocus2Selected: All foci of the ellipse selected. Now select a point on the ellipse.
handlers.ellipseFocus1Selected: One focus of the ellipse selected. Now select a second non-antipodal focus.
handlers.ellipseInitiallyToSmall: To create an ellipse initially you must select a point on the ellipse that is further away from each focus. Select a different location further from the foci.
handlers.threePointCircleRepeatPointSelected: The two points of three points that determine a three point circle are not allowed to be identical. Select another location.
handlers.threePointCircleFirstPointSelected: The first point of the three point circle have been selected. Now select another.
handlers.threePointCircleSecondPointSelected: The second point of the three point circle have been selected. Now select another.
handlers.measuredCircleCenterSelected: Center of circle selected. Now select a measurement, measurable object, or measurement label.
handlers.firstMustCreateMeasurable: To use this tool you must first create a measurement or measurable object.
handlers.measuredCircleSelect: Select (or create a) point, then select a measurement, circle or a line segment to use to determine the radius.
handlers.rotationPointSelected: Rotation point selected. Now select a measurement, measurable object, or measurement label.
handlers.translationLineOrSegmentSelected: Axis of translation selected. Now select a measurement, measurable object, or measurement label.
handlers.circleCenterSelected: Center of circle selected. Now select a point on the circle.
handlers.pointDistanceHandlerNoPoint: Before using this tool you must create at least two points.
handlers.duplicatePointDistanceMeasurement: The distance between points {pt0Name} and {pt1Name} has already been measured. This distance is measurement {measurementName}.
handlers.duplicatePointCoordinateMeasurement: The coordinates of point {ptName} have already been measured.
handlers.duplicateInversion: The selected circle already defines the inversion {trans}.
handlers.greatCircleInversion: Inversion over the line {name} is the same transformation as reflection. Use the reflection tool instead.
handlers.duplicatePointReflection: The selected point already defines the point reflection {trans}.
handlers.duplicateReflectionLine: The selected line already defines the reflection {trans}.
handlers.duplicateReflectionSegment: The selected segment already defines the reflection {trans}.
handlers.duplicateRotation: The selected point and rotation able already defines a rotation.
handlers.duplicateTranslation: The selected axis and translation distance able already defines a translation.
handlers.duplicateSegmentMeasurement: The selected line segment has already been measured. The length of segment {segName} is measurement {measurementName}.
handlers.duplicateLineAngleMeasurement: The angle between lines {line0Name} and {line1Name} has already been measured. This angle is measurement {measurementName}.
handlers.duplicateSegmentAngleMeasurement: The angle between segments {seg0Name} and {seg1Name} has already been measured. This angle is measurement {measurementName}.
handlers.segmentsWithOutCommonEndpoint: The selected segment does not have a common endpoint with the previously selected one. Select another.
handlers.segmentWithOutEndpointOnLine: The selected segment does not have a endpoint on the previously selected line. Select another.
handlers.lineDoesNotContainEndpointOfSegment: The selected line does contain an endpoint on the previously selected segment. Select another.
handlers.duplicateSegmentLineAngleMeasurement: The angle between segment {segName} and line {lineName} has already been measured. This angle is measurement {measurementName}.
handlers.antipodalPointMessage: The selected point is antipodal or equal to the first selected point. Select another.
handlers.antipodalPointMessage2: The selected point is antipodal or equal to the second selected point. Select another.
handlers.duplicateThreePointAngleMeasurement: The angle with vertex {pt1Name}, from {pt0Name} and to {pt2Name} has already been measured. This angle is measurement {measurementName}.
handlers.intersectionOneDimensionalSelected: One dimensional object {name} selected. Select another.
handlers.moveHandlerObjectOnBackOfSphere: Were you trying to move an object on the back of the sphere?  If so, press and hold the shift key to select objects on the back of the sphere.
handlers.selectionUpdate: Selection Update: {number} objects selected. Hold the Alt/Option key to add or subtract from the current selection.
handlers.pointCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a point at this location.
handlers.circleCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a circle with this center and radius.
handlers.measuredCircleCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a circle with this center and measurement for the radius.
handlers.ellipseCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already an ellipse with these foci and angle sum.
handlers.threePointCircleCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already circle with this center and radius.
handlers.segmentCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a line segment with these endpoints, this normal vector, and length.
handlers.lineCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a line with this normal vector.
handlers.lineThruPointPointSelected: Point selected. Now select a one dimensional object to determine the perpendicular.
handlers.lineThruPointLineSelected: Line {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.lineThruPointSegmentSelected: Segment {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.lineThruPointCircleSelected: Circle {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.lineThruPointEllipseSelected: Ellipse {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.lineThruPointParametricSelected: Parametric {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.antipodeDuplicate: The antipode of the selected point is the point {pointName} and has already been created.
handlers.polarLineDuplicate: The polar line of this point has already been created.
handlers.polarPointDuplicate: The polar points of this {object} has already been created.
handlers.newSegmentIntersectsOrToClose: The selected segment intersects the previously selected segments or the free endpoint of the selected segment is too close to one of the previously selected segments.
handlers.newSegmentMustHaveEndpointInCommon: The selected segment doesn't have an endpoint in common with the end point of the previously selected segments.
handlers.newSegmentMustCloseTriangle: The selected segment doesn't form a triangle with the previously selected segments.
handlers.previouslyMeasuredPolygon: This polygon was measured previously.  See measurement {token}.
handlers.deletedNodes: Successfully deleted {type} {name} and {number} {objects} that depend on it.
handlers.rotationNoObjectUpdate: Mouse location determines the rotation. No object selected to rotate about.
handlers.rotationAboutEquator: Rotating about the north pole of the screen sphere.

objectTree.triangleWithEdges: The area of a triangle with ordered edges {edges}. Area: {val}
objectTree.polygonWithEdges: The area of a polygon with ordered edges {edges}. Area: {val}

objectTree.angleSegmentLine: Angle formed by segment {seg} and line {line} with measure {val}.
objectTree.angleLineSegment: Angle formed by line {line} and segment {seg} with measure {val}.

objectTree.lineThrough: Line through points {pt1} and {pt2} with normal vector <{normalX},{normalY},{normalZ}>
objectTree.polarLine: Polar line to point {pt} with normal vector <{normalX},{normalY},{normalZ}>
objectTree.segmentThrough: Line segment with endpoints {pt1} and {pt2} and normal vector <{normalX},{normalY},{normalZ}>

objectTree.tangentLineThru: Tangent line to {oneDimensionalParentType} {oneDimensional} through point {pt} with index {index}

constructions.clearConstructionMsg: You are about to clear your construction. This action cannot be undone and any unsaved work will be discarded.
constructions.logoutDialog: You are about to logout, any unsaved constructions will be discarded.
constructions.saveConstructionDialog: Please provide a short description for your construction.
constructions.exportDimensionsInvalidWarning: Export dimensions must be between 200px and 1200px. Please try again.
constructions.unsavedConstructionMsg: You have unsaved work. Do you want to stay on this page and keep your work or switch to another page and discard your work.
constructions.unsavedObjectsMsg: You have unsaved work. Loading a new construction will remove all the current ones. Do you want to proceed or cancel?
